description: Comprehensive OSINT source collection for the PAI OSINT skill, synthesized from 6 parallel research agents

github_repos.description: Major GitHub repositories for OSINT tools, frameworks, and curated lists

sources.name: jivoi/awesome-osint
sources.description: Definitive curated list of OSINT tools and resources with 24.9K stars. The most widely referenced OSINT meta-list on GitHub.

sources.name: lockfale/OSINT-Framework
sources.description: Interactive tree-based OSINT tool directory with 10.8K stars. Powers the osintframework.com website with D3.js visualization.

sources.name: hslatman/awesome-threat-intelligence
sources.description: Curated collection of threat intelligence resources, tools, and feeds with 9.8K stars.

sources.name: cipher387/osint_stuff_tool_collection
sources.description: Massive collection of 1000+ online OSINT tools organized by category with 7.5K stars.

sources.name: sherlock-project/sherlock
sources.description: Username search across 400+ social networks with 73K stars. The most popular OSINT tool on GitHub.

sources.name: soxoj/maigret
sources.description: Builds dossiers from usernames across 3000+ sites with 19K stars. Extends Sherlock's approach significantly.

sources.name: mxrch/GHunt
sources.description: Offensive Google framework for investigating Google accounts with 18.4K stars. Extracts data from Google services.

sources.name: megadose/holehe
sources.description: Maps email addresses to registered platforms via password reset flows with 10.2K stars.

sources.name: smicallef/spiderfoot
sources.description: OSINT automation platform with 200+ data collection modules and 16.7K stars. Web UI for investigations.

sources.name: sundowndev/phoneinfoga
sources.description: Phone number intelligence gathering framework with 15.9K stars. Validates, formats, and gathers info on phone numbers.

sources.name: laramies/theHarvester
sources.description: Gathers emails, subdomains, hosts, and URLs from public sources with 15.7K stars. Staple recon tool.

sources.name: owasp-amass/amass
sources.description: Attack surface mapping and asset discovery using 50+ data sources with 14.2K stars. OWASP flagship project.

sources.name: projectdiscovery/subfinder
sources.description: Fast passive subdomain enumeration tool with 13.1K stars. Uses multiple sources for comprehensive results.

sources.name: projectdiscovery/nuclei
sources.description: Template-based vulnerability scanner with 27.2K stars. Community-driven templates for rapid security checks.

sources.name: s0md3v/Photon
sources.description: Incredibly fast OSINT web crawler that extracts URLs, emails, files, and more with 12.7K stars.

sources.name: OpenCTI-Platform/opencti
sources.description: Open cyber threat intelligence platform for organizing and visualizing threat data with 8.9K stars.

sources.name: MISP/MISP
sources.description: Threat intelligence sharing platform for structured threat information with 6.1K stars. Used by CERTs worldwide.

sources.name: lanmaster53/recon-ng
sources.description: Modular web reconnaissance framework with 5.4K stars. Metasploit-like interface for OSINT gathering.

sources.name: p1ngul1n0/blackbird
sources.description: Account search by username and email across 600+ platforms with 5.7K stars.

sources.name: six2dez/reconftw
sources.description: Automated reconnaissance tool chain that orchestrates multiple tools with 7.2K stars.

sources.name: khast3x/h8mail
sources.description: Email OSINT and breach hunting tool with 4.9K stars. Searches multiple breach databases.

sources.name: DedSecInside/TorBot
sources.description: Dark web crawling and OSINT tool for Tor hidden services with 3.8K stars.

sources.name: Ph055a/OSINT_Collection
sources.description: Curated collection focused exclusively on free OSINT resources with 2.3K stars.

sources.name: ARPSyndicate/awesome-intelligence
sources.description: Collaboratively curated list of OSINT and intelligence resources with 2.3K stars.

sources.description: One-stop OSINT resource covering all major investigation domains with 2.2K stars.

sources.description: Comprehensive list of tools for cryptocurrency and blockchain investigations with 1.9K stars.

sources.description: OSINT cheat sheet with tools, tips, and quick-reference commands with 1.8K stars.

sources.description: Social media intelligence (SOCINT) tools collection with 1.7K stars.

sources.description: Collection of OSINT tools specifically for dark web investigations with 1.6K stars.

sources.description: Penetration testing-focused OSINT tools for offensive security with 1.1K stars.

sources.description: Country-specific OSINT resources organized by nation with 784 stars.

sources.description: Bellingcat's official investigation toolkit with curated OSINT tools with 474 stars.

sources.description: Image research and reverse image search tools for OSINT with 419 stars.

sources.description: Blockchain analysis and cryptocurrency OSINT tools with 345 stars.

sources.description: Geolocation resources and tools for OSINT investigations with 291 stars.

sources.description: Social media OSINT tools and techniques collection with 758 stars.

sources.description: AI-driven identity verification and people search platform used by enterprises and investigators.

sources.name: Spokeo
sources.description: Aggregates public records and social media profiles for US-focused people search.

sources.name: BeenVerified
sources.description: Background check platform with AI validation covering criminal records, addresses, and associates.

sources.name: TruePeopleSearch
sources.description: Clean, free US people lookup with name, phone, and address search capabilities.

sources.name: WhitePages
sources.description: Phone number, address, and background check lookup for US individuals.

sources.name: FastPeopleSearch
sources.description: Free US public records search with name, phone, and address lookups.

sources.name: Radaris
sources.description: People search covering employment history, criminal records, and public records.

sources.name: Intelius
sources.description: Comprehensive background check service with criminal, property, and personal data.

sources.name: PeekYou
sources.description: Builds unified digital profiles by aggregating a person's presence across the web.

sources.name: OSINT Industries
sources.description: Professional OSINT platform searching 1500+ sources for comprehensive people lookup.

sources.description: Free people lookup by name, address, phone, email, or IP address.

sources.description: Username search across 500+ social networks, domains, and trademarks.

sources.name: WhatsMyName
sources.description: Open source username enumeration across 1500+ platforms with JSON-based detection.

sources.description: Professional email discovery and verification platform for finding business email addresses.

sources.description: Reverse email and phone lookups across 140+ services to identify associated accounts.

sources.name: Sync.me

sources.name: PimEyes

sources.description: Reverse image search engine indexing 70B+ images for finding image origins and copies.

sources.description: Russian search engine's image search, widely regarded as best-in-class for facial recognition queries.

sources.description: Deep malware analysis sandbox with detailed behavioral reports across multiple OS platforms.

community_media.description: OSINT podcasts, newsletters, blogs, and online communities

sources.name: The Privacy, Security, & OSINT Show
sources.description: Michael Bazzell's long-running podcast with 312 archived episodes covering OSINT, privacy, and security.

sources.name: The OSINTion Podcast
sources.description: Joe Gray's podcast covering OSINT techniques, tools, and social engineering topics.

sources.name: OSINT Curious Webcasts
sources.description: Archived webcasts and content from the OSINT Curious project founded by Micah Hoffman.

sources.name: Hacking Humans
sources.description: CyberWire podcast focused on social engineering, phishing, and human-targeted attacks.

sources.name: OSINT Cocktail Podcast
sources.description: Podcast hosted by Kirby Plessas covering corporate OSINT investigations and tradecraft.

sources.name: NeedleStack Podcast
sources.description: Authentic8's podcast on OSINT techniques for analysts, investigators, and security professionals.

sources.name: ShadowDragon Podcast
sources.description: Nico Dekens' podcast on digital investigations and OSINT from the ShadowDragon platform.

sources.name: Week in OSINT (Sector035)
sources.description: Weekly newsletter and blog by Sector035 curating the best OSINT content since 2018.

sources.name: The OSINT Newsletter
sources.description: Jake Creps' twice-weekly Substack newsletter covering OSINT tools, techniques, and news.

sources.name: tl;dr sec
sources.description: Weekly security newsletter by Clint Gibler covering security research, tools, and OSINT content.

sources.name: Digital Digging (Henk van Ess)
sources.description: Henk van Ess' newsletter with 8000+ subscribers covering Google dorking and search techniques.

sources.name: Nixintel Blog
sources.description: Steven Harris' OSINT techniques blog with detailed walkthroughs and investigation methodologies.

sources.name: Bellingcat Resources
sources.description: Bellingcat's resource section with case studies, how-to guides, and investigation methodology articles.

sources.name: Dutch OSINT Guy Blog
sources.description: Nico Dekens' blog covering OSINT techniques from his law enforcement and private sector experience.

sources.name: r/OSINT Subreddit
sources.description: Reddit's OSINT community with 200K+ members sharing tools, techniques, and investigation help.

sources.name: Bellingcat Discord
sources.description: Bellingcat's Discord server for collaborative investigation discussions and OSINT community networking.

sources.name: The OSINTion Discord
sources.description: Joe Gray's OSINTion community Discord for OSINT practitioners and social engineering enthusiasts.

sources.name: Openosint Slack
sources.description: Open OSINT Slack workspace for real-time collaboration among OSINT practitioners.

sources.name: Trace Labs Community
sources.description: Trace Labs community focused on using OSINT to locate missing persons through crowdsourced efforts.

practitioners.description: Key people in the OSINT community including researchers, instructors, journalists, and tool creators

sources.name: Michael Bazzell
sources.description: Former FBI agent, author of OSINT Techniques (11th Ed.) and Extreme Privacy. The most recognized name in OSINT.

sources.name: Eliot Higgins
sources.description: Founded Bellingcat, pioneered open source investigation of conflicts. MacArthur Fellow and author of We Are Bellingcat.

sources.name: Nico Dekens (@Dutch_OsintGuy)
sources.description: SANS instructor and former Dutch law enforcement veteran specializing in social media OSINT and digital investigations.

sources.name: Micah Hoffman (@webbreacher)
sources.description: Founded OSINT Curious, created MyOSINT Training, SANS author. Leading OSINT educator and tool creator.

sources.name: Matt Edmondson
sources.description: Author of SANS SEC497 and SEC587 OSINT courses. Founder of Argelius Labs.

sources.name: Joe Gray (@C_3PJoe)
sources.description: The OSINTion founder, social engineering expert, author of Practical Social Engineering (No Starch Press).

sources.name: Sector035
sources.description: Pseudonymous curator of the Week in OSINT newsletter since 2018, the OSINT community's essential weekly digest.

sources.name: Jake Creps
sources.description: OSINT Newsletter author and podcast host covering tools, techniques, and industry news.

sources.name: Steven Harris (Nixintel)
sources.description: SANS instructor and start.me curator known for detailed OSINT technique blog posts and training.

sources.name: Griffin Glynn (Hatless1der)
sources.description: Curator of the Ultimate OSINT Collection, one of the most comprehensive OSINT resource pages.

sources.name: Rae Baker
sources.description: Co-author of Deep Dive, maritime intelligence specialist with expertise in vessel tracking and investigation.

sources.name: Henk van Ess
sources.description: Google dorking expert and Digital Digging newsletter author with 8000+ subscribers.

sources.name: Craig Silverman
sources.description: Editor of the Verification Handbook, ProPublica reporter specializing in online misinformation investigation.

sources.name: Christina Lekati
sources.description: Social engineering and OSINT specialist, BlackHat trainer combining psychology with technical investigation.

sources.name: Kirby Plessas
sources.description: Corporate investigations specialist and host of the OSINT Cocktail podcast.

sources.name: Aric Toler
sources.description: Former Bellingcat trainer, now New York Times visual investigations journalist using OSINT for reporting.

sources.name: Giancarlo Fiorella
sources.description: Bellingcat Education Lead responsible for training journalists and researchers in OSINT methodology.

sources.name: Benjamin Strick
sources.description: Centre for Information Resilience investigator specializing in open source conflict and human rights analysis.

sources.name: Sofia Santos
sources.description: Creator of popular geolocation exercises used worldwide for OSINT training and skill development.

sources.name: Robert Sell
sources.description: Founder of Trace Labs, pioneering the use of crowdsourced OSINT CTFs to find missing persons.

sources.name: Chris Poulter
sources.description: Founder of OSINT Combine, building tools and training for the OSINT practitioner community.

sources.name: Lisette Abercrombie (Technisette)
sources.description: Dutch police OSINT specialist known for social media investigation techniques and training.

sources.name: Ryan Benson
sources.description: Google DFIR analyst, creator of Hindsight (Chrome forensics) and Unfurl (URL investigation) tools.

sources.name: Julia Bayer
sources.description: Founder of Quiztime daily geolocation challenges, DW journalist specializing in verification.

sources.name: Nathaniel Fried
sources.description: CEO of OSINT Industries, UK OSINT community contributor building commercial OSINT tools.
